content: continue in 3x3 rib knit the knits and purl the purls note when rejoining the 2 selvedge sts that had been slipped while working flat will come together to make a new purl rib in the next round increase 1 st pw m1p in each of these 2 joining purl ribs to make them 3 sts wide now 124sts work 3x3 rib for 2 more 6 from co edge switch back to 4 0mm adjust the beg of round so that 1st st is a k st not starting in the middle of a p rib so if you re starting with a p st or two work them to the right needle then re-stablish the beg of round there place a marker if you like decrease round decrease 1 st in each rib to switch back to 2x2 rib k1 k2tog p1 p2tog repeat to end of round 80sts work 2x2 rib for 6 more or 12 from co edge 2x2 rib = k2 p2 repeat to end when desired length bind off loosely using larger needle if you need to weave in all ends and get cozy on a side note i do a little thing that s hard to explain where i wrap the 2 sts at the bottom/beginning of the handle/spout slits before separating them for working the sides flat then when joining the 2 sides back at the top i wrap them together again this reinforces the slit openings so they don t stretch out over time not sure exactly how to explain this in words more than what i just did so hopefully some of you will understand © 2015 suzanne resaul please do whatever you like with this information i would ask that this pattern/file/photos not be copied or sold thanks © 2015 suzanne resaul
